meanings.definition: A sandbank or sandbar that makes the water shallow.
meanings.sent1: The boat got stuck on the shoals near the shore.
meanings.sent2: The sailors navigated carefully around the shoals to avoid running aground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids built a sandcastle on the shoals, pretending it was a secret fortress.
meanings.sent4: The shoals of the river whispered ancient stories to those who listened.
meanings.sent5: The golden sunlight danced on the shoals, creating a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: A large group of fish swimming together.
meanings.sent1: The divers were amazed by the colorful shoals of fish in the coral reef.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen cast their nets hoping to catch a shoal of mackerel.
meanings.sent3: The shoals of fish moved in perfect harmony, like a synchronized underwater ballet.
meanings.sent4: In the deep blue sea, the shoals of fish resembled a living tapestry.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering shoals of fish seemed to paint the ocean with vibrant hues.

meanings.definition: A large number of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The stadium was filled with a shoal of cheering fans.
meanings.sent2: The city market bustled with a shoal of shoppers on the weekend.
meanings.sent3: The shoal of books on the library shelf seemed to whisper stories of adventures.
meanings.sent4: In the busy city streets, a shoal of cars honked impatiently in the traffic jam.
meanings.sent5: The shoal of stars in the night sky twinkled like diamonds scattered across black velvet.
